snippet: Five detectives responsible for investigating sex crimes followed up on only 14 percent of reported cases in three years, a city audit has concluded.
abstract: New Orleans Inspector Gen Edouard R Quatrevaux releases audit of city's police department revealing 'persistent, systemic' management failure that allowed five detectives tasked with investigating sex crimes to ignore hundreds of reported cases; investigation found records of follow-up efforts in only 14 percent of such calls over three years.
lead_paragraph: Five detectives responsible for investigating sex crimes followed up on only 14 percent of reported cases in three years, a city audit has concluded.

headline.main: New Orleans Police Routinely Ignored Sex Crimes, Report Finds
headline.print_headline: New Orleans Police Routinely Ignored Sex Crimes, Report Finds
